children.text: The damp-proof course (DPC) has been installed into the brickwork above the floor level, which will allow dampness into the building.
Part 3.3.5.8 Damp-proof courses and flashings - installation of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) requires that
‘Damp-proof courses and flashings must be located so as to form a continuous damp-proofing barrier around the bottom perimeter of walls where constructed on a concrete slab’ .
Additionally, Australian Standard AS 4773.2 Masonry in Small Buildings, requires that
‘Damp-proof Courses (DPCs) will be installed in masonry walls where required to form a continuous damp-proofing barrier around the building’,
‘The DPC shall be placed as low as possible in the wall and in no case higher than the finished floor level’.
The placement of the damp-proof course will have to be rectified to stop the long-term occurrence of rising damp, which will require these areas be reconstructed.
